titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New Utrecht land deeds and executor documents 1974.244
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:43 +0000.

did.unittitle: New Utrecht land deeds and executor documents
did.abstract: This collection contains two deeds for property in the town of New Utrect in Kings County, purchased by William Dowling from Mary Bullocke. Also included are a bond and an assignment of mortgage signed by Francis Hopkins in his capacity as executor of the will of Sarah Sears, late of Fort Hamilton, New Utrecht.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New Utrecht land deeds and executor documents, 1974.244, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
